Notes.Text:
This update for ImageMagick fixes the following issues:

- Memory allocation failure in AcquireMagickMemory (CVE-2016-8862) [bsc#1007245]
- update incomplete patch of CVE-2016-6823 [bsc#1001066]
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: Integer overflow in the BMP coder in ImageMagick before 7.0.2-10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via crafted height and width values, which triggers an out-of-bounds write.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The AcquireMagickMemory function in MagickCore/memory.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.3.3 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted image, which triggers a memory allocation failure.
